intro: Euaraliopsis alpina, commonly known as the alpine euaraliopsis, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, rocky or alpine soils, often found in mountainous areas. Its growth habit and morphology are adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds. Euaraliopsis alpina plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh environment and supports local biodiversity.
